document.title: Louisiana Standards for English Language Arts

01B9150F26C84E1BAB11241EB9759B05.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4723C64311594B299BAE26D95B9EE402.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

07991806566C457A8981F78B7126CD54.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

DC33AE6863AC482C83146E380C011999.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

1D1E9AEB63EC4F6CBD9A903ECED0571E.description: With guidance and support from adults, participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

CD18B8DFF69A432F881674EFD53443C1.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

50419BBFDF9F4EFEACDDE3A8BC079FD3.description: Writing - Research to Build and Present Knowledge

36C0B67D43B841059A6875D6C3CC6938.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, explore a variety of digital tools by participating in the production of a published work.

EDEB99ECA9304CC9AB11B6AA69446FB6.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

832D724E77144E8E98BB4853695BB43B.description: With guidance and support, orally respond to questions and suggestions from adults and peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

7F116DF5CA5C41B981746CEDDB95D4E3.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a different approach.

95A2FC8A9AB24B17A3605487ADA0854E.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

04D1FBC69ADE4522921989E46ABE87BC.description: Writing - Production and Distribution of Writing

2559204C5AD643BEB74BF92BA381F8FD.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

C05107590664498586EB466BF11B7810.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

EC31E54EEE444ADEB140857CD1FD742C.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

2147B4B80137415B985AA85E0320FEFB.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

142A535110584CF6BB38591B3B53E07B.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

14A09C6D350647489FFBEAAA85ACCB25.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

0746CB1DAEB04561926D9B2EA519182F.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

1B4071EBCFC54D558B5F3723A798DEAB.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

2EB21A0003224336813DE651DAA5F711.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

338323335AB04D1B985510A6869168D0.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

7DD88AC9BDFB4C5E98EEAE6318286931.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

85D933A142E642B68DBBFA2E6C53FB6B.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

B9C413E0EAD64D8DA9BEBD9647F51F9E.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

06D9DF23F4414B3F8B56CD84C56EADF7.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

0097FCC139784468A1A390A12F4ABD39.description: With guidance and support, use the most frequently occurring inflections as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less).

89A0691712994F518CF7520E6BA67E41.description: With guidance and support, identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

FDE961085ED24A2B9E607B685A8E9993.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

BB93F18027F242F2BDF5E9F2D6B646DF.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

3010CA1EE29342A39144F09C28906328.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

FD4338BF82F84203855BBDBE0FA31E1A.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

8553A0DD06F44515ADB868AFA0146852.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

22235867ADC44AB5B252A9ECC2EFA364.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

2E6BB0CD352241538F4CE36C7CAB5F71.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

4EBDAF6B18A646AC9B0E202BA0728DB9.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

9C64D19C40D747F5B5817384794E740B.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

05E9C1E7D9074554B13F4764D988E884.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

544AFE7021AA481280AAC20855C3E717.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

81C0CAF63D344A828918AB6A49607CEE.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

F797E0039C414AC4B42542237DFDFC35.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

26950BE425BA49D4882517391E68D3A3.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

EAA84EBCAA9A4B609AD4625475351574.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

E4F2447B6C1549198D3FF37F7EDED0AE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

54BA39A6A4154908957F49486AE1E590.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

AA185FDBBB914D0F98334FB9ECE240CB.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

1DB1CA5A228B4A86A6791866FDC732C9.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

64287E9400944D0289C87AC6BA551C76.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

B22FF92BFF9B4837BCF81ABF90E84920.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

EEF3804E367744B28A7793E8FD25F7D0.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

E6A23773445E49C6AD39882B312A67B4.description: Speaking and Listening - Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

B771A8F478B946319848C15C1426D9F1.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

C5BEFDF201A1445B95A8BE14E9E75A1E.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

5FFEBDD2153B482386EE6547781AD000.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

F4BC8B9112FF4CD2A955823F7DF01372.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

2B17C0642B8E4A318B9A306A113A9635.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

3EF3A9664C6D4409AB1A147CBFFC47C7.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

51B6AC08C4104ECEBF6B14F0FB5E2503.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

1BB308250C5C49C28D3500F38068B414.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

A8AA8F10DDF34897A2F2D270C34F61C5.description: Speaking and Listening - Comprehension and Collaboration

55BDD131E6B249D79A794C6B701B8408.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

1EAFDEA9E4074A169D7E4D3A51939710.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

BD51E76E88404BD4B11B95E40F12F736.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

4BF8601488214ACD928102E866028F83.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

BC6AA4DA2EC7471D8FA618CBA4C031C1.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

FBC52082A2DD4B64BCCD65C5CA278239.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

49CB3A3B3EA240ACB6DE86AFDBD76CC3.description: Reading: Foundational Skills - Phonics and Word Recognition

2F31C40FA6944858BF772EC1F454A165.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

C5B7E1165F2A487DAED9E268EF6FB5DE.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.

3FAF7EDCBCA04B2AB7CC2B4BD5B7C1D3.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

BBACAC193E8042929CAA1E302477CA78.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

FF38BF7F18B64354BF506C486487A8D4.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

91DAE16547B849FD979AE59CA5FE9D52.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

8063FA7609BA4D5D9A0A559762468E82.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

1EFFF44C53F94527B53EF4E0B66E7B50.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

BA0FFBFFBE2449B2971C909186B1C1D6.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

950118FF91E04AA69FBA8E654E5FB9D7.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

3A3DBF9DE4414CABA9837FB043532A7C.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

D22778D6340E423AB40F4ADEFAE9AEE6.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

220EA12482C24DC099A6153639C3E71D.description: Reading: Informational Text - Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

05D93B235C2C40BFA7A7FF92BFA8A2B6.description: With prompting and support, identify similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic.

717E871F2D5E4234BA2B395C3C92277D.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

D7C1D1BD20F041C19A6EED9F04A33822.description: With prompting and support, identify the reason(s) an author gives to support point(s) in a text.

CF12FAF934854B84BFE0D7690B803230.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

C6A9F70E396F44D883F02F16E2E2F692.description: With prompting and support, make connections between the illustrations and the text.

3AAC2235C02C41A89D6A7E7A14EC8205.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

C454D73B4C1F4F3295A23CDE7948D5D2.description: Reading: Informational Text - Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

3F5328CBA6E64D6C9ED4790ADB16129D.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and the illustrator of a text in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

4C53A3E1FBF54E8C8BCAA16C9FE47F36.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

A5176CA9B4C54D3E9ED44C8EBFE1AD2A.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

EBAF9D91E50E49B0A6F48B6E7B84E72F.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

C7D901705867456F9E44AF76B34BC5C8.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

588D4CB69F7849FE8C2B6B5FF953CE09.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

E326017B55BC48ECB6CA814A8E79B11E.description: Reading: Informational Text - Craft and Structure

D4C39DB3E5574D8598F62A821DF6F4DA.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

EA55206CBCF94AF4B756B336C0DC35CE.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

2FE9A41CBA0148F9AA4400DE0F7B8DF0.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

C7C9F33DCF594E9FAE5730BBFB930274.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

CFB87A2A281045BA8331343550621BE8.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

ED16DEA57569413CB9ABB2BAC0B88841.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

7E0866EFC12B4858A904D2D347982462.description: Reading: Informational Text - Key Ideas and Details

C2DCA23478314ED3BA14EA26D9ACB517.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

AEE633F2560E4BE2ABA5EAF468092B4F.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

BB4A923FD50E4FCD82818A53ECF73018.description: Reading: Literature - Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3B1641DD54CE42BA96F33D47D8F61A60.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

504EAB540F3941AEBD225F6B0A2586A2.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

D6BDB2B9E527461EAE41498FA127D4BF.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

2F08C78396CA44B59462F120A8787D29.description: With prompting and support, make connections between the illustrations in the story and the text.

480903218B4A4EB49176C61A32F12D21.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

801659FD5C7942D2A03B380E977995B2.description: Reading: Literature - Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

1372A6565DF04B4DAC786841CDBFFEA5.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and the illustrator of a story in telling the story.

EA39E6F934404CC791DDFEDFBF50E809.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

75F2FAF594CA4569A47C50B268D041F8.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

59827E8938C341F38C64B44A55075B00.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

A9EA8BA1B21A4DCBA52BE3D696E3161A.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

135ADCDDF50043CA89640CD338F5028C.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

A13CA515C3DC439DB1ED2BA9CC2D9A4F.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

9B43321384C3487DB08A15788CB550AB.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

50A8E1421BD74E338B6C9F71E105C744.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

C3452B4A37B940728700CB95A8A5807E.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

053B9F04B9CB44E89E1C6769F04E86BC.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

B361D2EA22DA43059D0AC6BBE02052F7.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

C8525AC3EF8F4E3F9F3ED3EE170E4C56.description: Reading: Literature - Key Ideas and Details
